parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Mid. and pass: To make a compact (agreement) with (together), covenant with, agree.
To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of arguros; silvery, i.e. cash; specially, a silverling.
